title: Archives, "Don Wallance objects", mid-20th century
dimensions:
part LLL (prototype chair): unfolded: 76.6 x 42.6 x 55 cm (30 3/16 x 16 3/4 x 21 5/8 in. )
folded: 11 x 42.6 x 90 cm (4 5/16 x 16 3/4 x 35 7/16 in. )
creditline: Gift of David and Gregory Wallance
description: Various prototypes and objects from Don Wallance Archive, including: One protype chair consisting of bucket-type seat on metal shaft with four splayed feet; covered in red woven fabric; one prototype of a folding chair(?) ("LLL"): flat plywood seat and back mounted on bent tubular metal frame, hinged under seat; two chair elements: one roughly triangular metal chair-frame part(?) with oval tubular metal brace near apex ("MMM"); one roughly U-shaped tubular metal chair-frame part(?) ("NNN").  Cutlery, tableware and other prototypes.

tombstone.epitaph:
Archives, "Don Wallance objects", mid-20th century.
mid-20th century. various. Gift of David and Gregory Wallance. 1991-81-2.
